cushion.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a cloth bag filled with soft material that you put on a chair or the floor to make it more comfortable
cushion.translation[0].definitions[1].de: something that stops one thing from hitting another thing
cushion.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Good sports shoes should provide a cushion when running.
cushion.translation[0].definitions[2].de: something, especially money, that prevents you from being immediately affected by a bad situation
cushion.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Savings can act as a cushion against unemployment.
cushion.translation[0].definitions[3].de: the soft rubber edge of the table used for playing billiards or snooker
cushion.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to make the effect of a fall or hit less painful, for example by having something soft in the way
cushion.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: His landing was cushioned by the fresh snow that had fallen.
cushion.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to protect someone from an unpleasant situation or the unpleasant effects of something
cushion.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: generous leaving allowances to help cushion the blow of redundancy
